placeName: Radhanagar Beach, Havelock Island (Andaman and Nicobar Islands)
bestTime: November to May (pleasant weather and clear sea)
nearestBus: No bus stand available on Havelock Island
nearestAirport: Veer Savarkar International Airport, Port Blair (approx. 55 km by sea and road)
accessibility: Accessible by ferry from Port Blair; road transport on the island available; wheelchair-friendly beach access limited due to natural terrain
guidedTours: Available through local operators, mainly in English and Hindi
parking: Available at ferry points on Havelock Island; charges vary (₹20-₹50)
nearbyAmenities: Resorts, cafes, small eateries, shops, restrooms
specialNotes: Famous for spectacular sunsets; awarded Asia’s Best Beach in 2004 by Time Magazine; pristine coral reefs ideal for snorkeling and diving.

placeName: Cellular Jail, Port Blair (Andaman and Nicobar Islands)
bestTime: October to May (pleasant weather for sightseeing)
nearestBus: Phoenix Bay Bus Stand, Port Blair (approx. 3 km)
nearestAirport: Veer Savarkar International Airport, Port Blair (approx. 5 km)
accessibility: Easily accessible by road; mostly wheelchair-friendly with ramps and paved paths
guidedTours: Available in multiple languages including English and Hindi; audio guides offered
parking: Available near the site; free or nominal charges
nearbyAmenities: Cafes, souvenir shops, restrooms, small parks
specialNotes: Known as Kala Pani, a colonial prison used by British to imprison freedom fighters; Light and Sound Show available in evenings depicting historical narratives.

placeName: Mahatma Gandhi Marine National Park, Wandoor (Andaman and Nicobar Islands)
timings: 9:00 AM to 4:30 PM (seasonal closures may apply)
entryFee: ₹100 per person (additional fees for snorkeling and boat rides)
bestTime: November to May (clear weather ideal for marine activities)
nearestAirport: Veer Savarkar International Airport, Port Blair (approx. 30 km)
accessibility: Accessible by road; moderate trekking involved for some islands; not fully wheelchair-friendly
guidedTours: Available, including snorkeling and glass-bottom boat tours with multilingual guides
parking: Available at Wandoor jetty; nominal charges
nearbyAmenities: Basic restaurants, restrooms, souvenir shops near entrance
specialNotes: Includes several islands with coral reefs and diverse marine life; snorkeling and scuba diving popular; eco-conservation efforts ongoing.

placeName: Chidiya Tapu, Port Blair (Andaman and Nicobar Islands)
bestTime: November to February (migratory birds and pleasant weather)
nearestBus: Aberdeen Bus Stand, Port Blair (approx. 15 km)
nearestAirport: Veer Savarkar International Airport, Port Blair (approx. 15 km)
accessibility: Accessible by road; wheelchair-friendly pathways limited
specialNotes: Known as the Sunset Point; famous for birdwatching with species like sea eagles and kingfishers; also called the Bird Island.

placeName: Ross Island, Port Blair (Andaman and Nicobar Islands)
nearestBus: Aberdeen Bus Stand, Port Blair (approx. 3 km to jetty)
nearestAirport: Veer Savarkar International Airport, Port Blair (approx. 5 km)
accessibility: Accessible by boat; walking required on uneven terrain; limited wheelchair access
guidedTours: Available with English and Hindi-speaking guides
nearbyAmenities: Cafes and shops near jetty area
specialNotes: Former British administrative headquarters with ruins; known for deer sightings and historical buildings; underwater coral reefs nearby.

placeName: Neil Island (Shaheed Dweep), Andaman District (Andaman and Nicobar Islands)
nearestBus: No bus stand available on Neil Island
nearestAirport: Veer Savarkar International Airport, Port Blair (approx. 40 km by sea and road)
accessibility: Accessible by ferry; road transport on island available; relatively easy terrain; limited wheelchair access
guidedTours: Local guides available; mostly in English and Hindi
parking: Available at ferry points; nominal charges
specialNotes: Known for its coral reefs, natural rock formations, and tranquil beaches; less crowded than Havelock.

category: Hill Station / Scenic Valley / Tribal Culture / Parks / Museum
nearestRailway: Araku Railway Station (~120 km from Visakhapatnam)
nearestBus: Araku Bus Stand (~1 km from town center)
accessibility: Hilly terrain; some spots not wheelchair accessible
nearbyAmenities: Tribal Museum, coffee shops, local dhabas, gardens
specialNotes: Famous for Araku Coffee, Tribal Museum, Padmapuram Gardens, Chaparai Waterfalls

category: Natural Limestone Caves / Geological Site / Religious Shrine
accessibility: Uneven cave floors, steps; not wheelchair friendly
specialNotes: Discovered by William King (1807); stalactites/stalagmites and Shiva shrine inside

category: Natural Underground Cave System / Geological Wonder / Historical Site
accessibility: Narrow passages, steps; not wheelchair friendly
nearbyAmenities: AP Tourism Haritha Hotel, food stalls, restrooms
specialNotes: Second-largest cave system in India; Buddhist relics; musical chamber

category: Freshwater Lake / Bird Sanctuary / Wildlife Attraction
accessibility: Boat rides needed; basic wheelchair access at entry
nearbyAmenities: Rest areas, small eateries, eco-tourism huts
specialNotes: Largest freshwater lake in India; Ramsar wetland site
